TextView.android:text: Issuance of Zoning Locational Clearance Without Inspection

This service caters Locational Clearance for building/electrical/business permit that does not involve site inspection of the area. Any owner or developer undertaking the construction of a new building or applying for expansion, renovation, or alteration must obtain a Locational/Zoning Clearance for locally significant projects when applying for a building permit. It is imperative that this clearance is secured prior to commencing construction to ensure compliance with the approved Comprehensive Land Use Plan (CLUP) and Zoning Ordinance of the municipality.
All persons and Government Institutions who intend to construct a Building and other related infrastructure
1. Application Form (1 Original and Notarized Copy)
Case 1: Locational Clearance for Business Permit:
1. Authorization (if applicant is not the owner)
2. A copy of approved Building and Electrical Permit
Case 2: Locational Clearance for Building Permit:
2. Authorization (if application is not the owner)
a. Building Plans, Elevation and Details
One set, design plans specification signed and sealed by: Architect/Civil Engineer, in case of architectural/ civil/structural documents
b. Bill of Materials and Estimates of the Building
Professional Electrical Engineer, in case of electrical documents
d. Electrical Bill of Materials and Estimates
Master Plumber, in case of plumbing documents
Municipal Assessor’s Office/ Bureau of Lands
6. Deed of Sale or Authorization (if applicant is not the owner of lot)
7. Certification/Clearance from DPWH (if the proposed project site is along the National Highway/Road)
Case 3: Locational Clearance for Electrical Permit:
2. Authorization (if the applicant is not the owner)
One set, design plans specification signed and sealed by: Professional Electrical Engineer
b. Electrical Bill of Materials and Cost Estimates
Municipal Assessor’s Office/Bureau of Lands of Owner/Applicant
5. Deed of Sale or Authorization (if applicant is not the owner of lot)
6. Certification/Clearance from DPWH (if the proposed project site is along the National Highway/Road)
Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH)
1. Submit the duly filled-up application forms w/ complete requirements.
1.1. Receive and record the application forms
1.2. Evaluate/ Assess of the complied documents.
1.4. Issuance of the Order of Payment for zoning fees.
1.5. Give the Order of Payment to the Client
2. Payment of the fees at the Municipal Treasurer’s Office.
2.2. Preparation of the Zoning Locational Clearance
2.3. Act on Zoning Locational Clearance by the Zoning Administrator
2.4. Issuance of the approved Zoning Locational Clearance/ Issuance of Disapproval
3.1. Release & logbook the clearance and get a copy for file in the office
4. Accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) and drop in the Feedback Box
4.1. Request the client to accomplish the Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) Form
Housing and Land Use Regulatory Board 2013 Schedule of Fees
A. Single residential structure attached or detached
₱3,600 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million regardless of the number of floors )
₱3,600 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million regardless of the number of floors )
₱2,880 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
E. Commercial, Industrial and Agro-Industrial Project Cost of which is:
₱7,200 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
(Gasoline Station, Cell Sites, Slaughter House, Treatment Plants, etc.)
₱7,200 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
₱7,200 + ( 1/10 of 1% of cost in excess of 2 million )
